entry.title: Cinematica Topologica
entry.summary: A topological method for calculate average speed.

entry.title: Quantum spherical model
entry.summary: We define a "quantum spherical model", a quantum lattice model.

entry.title: Topologization of electron liquids with Chern-Simons theory and quantum computation
entry.summary: We discuss a nexus among quantum topology, quantum physics and quantum computing.

entry.title: On the bracket problem in covariant Hamiltonian field theory
entry.summary: The polysymplectic phase space of covariant Hamiltonian field theory can be provided with the current algebra bracket.

entry.title: Space-time BRST symmetries
entry.summary: Bearing in mind BV quantization of gauge gravitation theory, we extend general covariant transformations to the BRST ones.

entry.title: Integrable geometry and Soliton equations in 2+1 dimensions
entry.summary: Some aspects of the connection between differential geometry and multidimensional soliton equations are discussed.

entry.title: Seiberg-Witten Invariants-An Expository Account
entry.summary: In this note, we give an exposition of the construction of Seiberg-Witten invariants.

entry.title: Asymptotic values of hyperbolic monopoles
entry.summary: We show that many hyperbolic monopoles can be distinguished from each other via their asymptotic values in contrast to the case of Euclidean monopoles.

entry.title: A Lax Pair for 2D Euler Equation
entry.summary: A Lax pair for the 2D Euler equation is found.

entry.title: Remarks on quantum transmutation
entry.summary: It is shown how formulas of the author for general operator transmutation can be adapted to a quantum group context

entry.title: Discretization and Moyal brackets
entry.summary: We give a q-analysis version of a discretization procedure of Kemmoku and Saito leading to an apparently new q-Moyal type bracket.

entry.title: Rieffel's deformation quantization and isospectral deformations
entry.summary: We demonstrate the relation between the isospectral deformation and Rieffel's deformation quantization by the action of $\R^d$.

entry.title: The Mathematical Universe in a Nutshell
entry.summary: The mathematical universe discussed here gives models of possible structures our physical universe can have.

entry.title: Recursion operators between degenerate Poisson structures
entry.summary: Two degenerate Poisson structures of the same rank possess a recursion operator if and only if their characteristic distributions coincide.

entry.title: Relations Among Universal Equations For Gromov-Witten Invariants
entry.summary: In this paper, we study relations among known universal equations for Gromov-Witten invariants at genus 1 and 2.

entry.title: Global Regularity for the Viscous Boussinesq Equations
entry.summary: The global regularity for the viscous Boussinesq equations is proved.
entry.arxiv:comment: Mathematical Methods in Appl. Sci. (in press)

entry.title: An introduction to the dimer model
entry.summary: Lecture notes from a minicourse given at the ICTP in May 2002.

entry.title: Structure theory of finite Lie conformal superalgebras
entry.summary: We develop structure theory of finite Lie conformal superalgebras.

entry.title: Twisted Hochschild Homology of Quantum Hyperplanes
entry.summary: We calculate the Hochschild dimension of quantum hyperplanes using the twisted Hochschild homology.

entry.title: A note on noncommutative holomorphic and harmonic functions on the unit disk
entry.summary: We study noncommutative versions of holomorphic and harmonic functions on the unit disk.

entry.title: UVW relations over a subvariety of a hyperelliptic Jacobian
entry.summary: This article extends relations of Mumford's UVW-expressions to those in subvarieties in a hyperelliptic Jacobian using Baker's method.

entry.title: Conformal blocks revisited
entry.summary: We give a simple coordinate free description of the WZW connection and derive its main properties.

entry.title: Instantons: topological aspects
entry.summary: Short survey to be published at the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics.

entry.title: Global solutions of quasilinear wave equations
entry.summary: We show that a general class of quasilinear wave equations have global solutions for small initial data as we conjectured in an earlier paper.

entry.title: Painlevé equations and the middle convolution
entry.summary: We use the middle convolution to obtain some old and new algebraic solutions of the Painlev\'e VI equations.

entry.title: A generalization of Fueter's Theorem
entry.summary: We show that Fueter's theorem holds for a more general class of quaternionic functions than those constructed by the Fueter's method.

entry.title: Gaussian fluctuations for βEnsembles
entry.summary: We study the Circular and Jacobi $\beta$-Ensembles and prove Gaussian fluctuations for the number of points in one or more intervals in the macroscopic scaling limit.

entry.title: A (2+1)-dimensional integrable spin model(the M-XXII equation) and Differential geometry of curves/surfaces
entry.summary: Using the differential geometry of curves and surfaces the Lakshmanan equivalent counterpart of the M-XXII equation is found ... .

entry.title: Drinfel'd Twists and Functional Bethe Ansatz
entry.summary: Using Functional Bethe Ansatz technique, factorizing Drinfel'd Twists for any finite dimensional irreducible representations of the Yangian Y(sl(2)) are constructed.

entry.title: A remark on boson-fermion correspondence
entry.summary: We give a simple explanaition of classical boson-fermion correspondence.

entry.title: Dynamics of charged particles and their radiation field
entry.summary: We investigate the adiabatic limit for classical charges coupled to their Maxwell field.

entry.title: Jets and connections in commutative and noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: It is emphasized that equivalent definitions of connections on modules over commutative rings are not so in noncommutative geometry.

entry.title: Krein's method in inverse scattering
entry.summary: A detailed discussion of the Krein's results (applicable for solving the inverse scattering problem) is given with complete proofs.

entry.title: Minimal Escape velocities
entry.summary: We give a new derivation of the minimal velocity estimates for unitary evolutions with some optimal bounds.

entry.title: Modern Mathematical Physics: what it should be?
entry.summary: Personal view of author on goals and content of Mathematical Physics.

entry.title: Periodic and almost periodic potentials in the inverse problems
entry.summary: We review basic ideas and basic examples of the theory of the inverse spectral problems.

entry.title: Analytic aspects of the Toda system: I. A Moser-Trudinger inequality
entry.summary: We analyze solutions of the Toda system and establish an optimal Moser-Trudinger inequality

entry.title: Characterizing Volume Forms
entry.summary: Old and new results for characterizing volume forms in functional integration.

entry.title: Monopoles
entry.summary: I survey the theory of Bogomolny monopoles and the various approaches to their study. These include the spectral curve, Nahm correspondence and rational maps.

entry.title: Weak asymptotics method
entry.summary: We present a new method for constructing solutions to nonlinear evolutionary equations describing the propagation and interaction of nonlinear waves.

entry.title: Differential geometry of fibre bundles over foliated manifolds
entry.summary: Any leafwise connection on a fibre bundle over a foliated manifold is proved to come from a connection on this fibre bundle.

entry.title: A remark on the matrix Airy function
entry.summary: An integral representation for matrix Airy function is presented

entry.title: The bracket and the evolution operator in covariant Hamiltonian field theory
entry.summary: No bracket determines the evolution operator in covariant (polysymplectic and multisymplectic) Hamiltonian field theory.

entry.title: Zonal Functions on $SO(p,q)$ Groups
entry.summary: Explicit expressions for zonal spherical functions of $SO(p,q)$ matrix groups are obtained using a generalized hypergeometric series of two variables.

entry.title: Noether conservation laws in infinite order Lagrangian formalism
entry.summary: Conservation laws related to the gauge invariance of Lagrangians and Euler-Lagrange operators in finite and infinite order Lagrangian formalisms are analyzed.

entry.title: Hypergeometric solutions of some algebraic equations
entry.summary: We give the hypergeometric solutions of some algebraic equations including the general fifth degree equation.

entry.title: Associated functions on $SO(p,q)$ Groups
entry.summary: Explicit expressions for associated spherical functions of $SO(p,q)$ matrix groups are obtained using a generalized hypergeometric series of two variables.

entry.title: Probabilistic Bell's Theorem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error.

entry.title: Non-Archimedean Geometry and Physics on Adelic Spaces
entry.summary: This is a brief review article of various applications of non-Archimedean geometry, p-adic numbers and adeles in modern mathematical physics.

entry.title: On the definition of higher order differential operators in noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: Several definitions of differential operators on modules over noncommutative rings are discussed.

entry.title: On analytic solutions to NSE in 3-D torus
entry.summary: We consider NSE with $H^1$-initial conditions on the 3-dimensional torus and prove that there exists a solution that is analytic in all variables.

entry.title: A New Method of Strong-Coupling Expansion
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a new method of strong-coupling expansion

entry.title: On Distribution of Zeros of Some Entire Functions
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate distribution of zeros for once quasipolynom and obtain exactly lower-bound for their modulus.

entry.title: Geodesic distances on density matrices
entry.summary: We find an upper bound for geodesic distances associated to monotone Riemannian metrics on positive definite matrices and density matrices.

entry.title: On Some p-Adic Series with Factorials
entry.summary: Some p-adic series with factorials are considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages; Published in Lecture Notes in Pure and Applied Mathematics, Vol. 192, 95-105 (1997)

entry.title: Fundamental solutions of pseudo-differential operators over p-adic fields
entry.summary: We show the existence of fundamental solutions for p-adic pseudo-differential operators with polynomial symbols.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Rend. Sem. Mat. Univ. Padova

entry.title: Laurent Expansions for Vertex Operators
entry.summary: A method is presented for using coherent vectors to calculate the explicit form of Schur polynomials which are the coefficients of Laurent expansion of a vertex operator.

entry.title: Dark Matter and Scale invariance
entry.summary: We point out that the vector meson $S$ first proposed by Weyl on the basis of scale invariance is a candidate for dark matter.

entry.title: Photon-added coherent states for exactly solvable Hamiltonians
entry.summary: Photon-added Gazeau-Klauder and Klauder-Perelomov coherent states are investigated. Application to P\"oschl-Teller potentials is given.

entry.title: Solvable Chaos
entry.summary: We present classes of discrete reversible systems which are at the same time chaotic and solvable.

entry.title: Integrable models with boundaries and defects
entry.summary: Two lectures given at the UK-Japan Winter School on 'Geometry and Analysis Towards Quantum Theory', Durham, January 2004.

entry.title: Remarks on modules over deformation quantization algebras
entry.summary: We study an asymptotic version of the Maslov-Hormander construction of Lagrangian distributions in terms of deformation quantization.

entry.title: Neumann system and hyperelliptic al functions
entry.summary: This article shows that the Neumann dynamical system is described well in terms of the Weierestrass hyperelliptic al functions.

entry.title: Random surfaces enumerating algebraic curves
entry.summary: These are notes from my lecture at 4ECM in Stockholm (June 2004).

entry.title: Why the Mickelsson-Faddeev algebra lacks unitary representations
entry.summary: A simple plausibility argument is given.

entry.title: Indefinite metric
entry.summary: The quantization of gauge fields with the help of the Gupta-Bleuler formalism is reviewed.

entry.title: Quantum Ergodicity and Mixing
entry.summary: This is an expository article for the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics on the subject in the title.

entry.title: Topology in Physics
entry.summary: The phenomenon of quantum number fractionalization is explained. The relevance of non-trivial phonon field topology is emphasized.

entry.title: Solvable Sextic Equations
entry.summary: Criteria are given for determining whether an irreducible sextic equation with rational coefficients is algebraically solvable over the complex numbers.

entry.title: Computable Integrability. Chapter 1: General notions and ideas
entry.summary: This is a preliminary version of the Chapter 1 of a book "Computable Integrability"

entry.title: Withdrawn
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Towards a microscopic derivation of the large phonon Boltzmann equation
entry.summary: We outline the kinetic limit for weakly nonlinear wave equations

entry.title: Classical Mechanics
entry.summary: An overview of the foundations of Classical Mechanics
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, ed. J.P. Francoise, G.L. Naber, Tsou Sheung Tsun, Vol. 1, 1--32, 2006, Elsevier, ISBN:978-0-12-512660-1.

entry.title: Quantization as a Consequence of Symmetry
entry.summary: It is argued that the Heisenberg relation on 4-spacetime is a necessary condition for the local gauge invariance of a classical wave in the 5-dimensional Kaluza-Klein theory.

entry.title: An Introduction to Hyperbolic Analysis
entry.summary: An introduction to Hyperbolic Analysis is presented.

entry.title: Random algebraic geometry, attractors and flux vacua
entry.summary: This is a submission to the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics (Elsevier, 2006) and conforms to its referencing guidelines.

entry.title: Sobolev inequality for localization of pseudo-relativistic energy
entry.summary: In this article we present Sobolev-type inequalities for the localization of pseudo-relativistic energy.

entry.title: Geometric Phases
entry.summary: The differential geometric aspects of Geometric Phases are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 27 pages LATEX. To appear in the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, Elsevier 2006

entry.title: Interpretations of Renyi Entropies And Divergences
entry.summary: In this paper a new operational definition of Renyi entropy and Renyi divergence is presented. Other operational definitions are mentioned.

entry.title: The modified Vlasov equations
entry.summary: The Vlasov system of equations for a plasma is given in relativistic form, and using the correct expression for the "Lorentz" force, that is the one guaranteing real self-consistency.

entry.title: Lagrangian mechanics without ordinary differential equations
entry.summary: A variational proof is provided of the existence and uniqueness of evolutions of regular Lagrangian systems.

entry.title: Spectral Localization in the Hierarchical Anderson Model
entry.summary: We prove that a large class of hierarchical Anderson models with spectral dimension ${\rm d}\leq 2$ has only pure point spectrum.

entry.title: Remarks on the formation and decay of multidimensional shock waves
entry.summary: In this paper, we present a formula describing the formation and decay of shock wave type solutions in some special cases.

entry.title: Invariants of nine dimensional real Lie algebras with nontrivial Levi decomposition
entry.summary: The generalized Casimir invariants of real indecomposable Lie algebras admitting a nontrivial Levi decomposition are determined.

entry.title: Collisional invariants for the phonon Boltzmann equation
entry.summary: For the phonon Boltzmann equation with only pair collisions we characterize the set of all collisional invariants under some mild conditions on the dispersion relation.

entry.title: Infinite dimensional covariance and non relativistic limits in time dependent theories
entry.summary: We give some account of investigations for the role of infinite dimensional algebras in time dependent systems.

entry.title: Deformation Quantization and Quaternions
entry.summary: The deformation quantization of Moyal-Weyl star product of functions of quaternions is investigated.

entry.title: Moyal-Weyl Star-products as Quasiconformal Mappings
entry.summary: The relation between the Moyal-Weyl deformation quantization and quasiconformal mappings of Riemann surfaces of complex analysis are shown by several examples.

entry.title: New integrable systems and a curious realisation of SO(N)
entry.summary: A multiparameter class of integrable systems is introduced.

entry.title: Noether conservation laws in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: Being quantized, conserved Noether symmetry functions are represented by Hermitian operators in the space of solutions of the Schrodinger equation, and their mean values are conserved.

entry.title: Algebras of infinite qubit systems
entry.summary: The input and output algebras of an infinite qubit system and their representations are described.

entry.title: Analytic geometry and semi-classical analysis
entry.summary: Expository paper on the relations between perturbation theory of pseudo-differential operators, finiteness theorems and deformations of Lagrangian varieties.

entry.title: Mass in the Hyperbolic Plane
entry.summary: The notions of mass and center of mass are extended to laminae of the hyperbolic plane. The resulting formulae contain many surprises.

entry.title: Cubic Derivative Nonlinear Schrodinger has Blowup Solutions
entry.summary: This paper is painfully withdrawn.

entry.title: Skew-orthogonal polynomials: the quartic case
entry.summary: We present an iterative technique to obtain skew-orthogonal polynomials with quartic weight, arising in the study of symplectic ensembles of random matrices.

entry.title: Kinetic Equations for Quantum Many-Particle Systems
entry.summary: The current status of the derivation of kinetic equations from quantum many-particle dynamics is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: for: Modern Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, Springer Selecta, 12 pages

entry.title: Energy Current Correlations For Weakly Anharmonic Lattices
entry.summary: We discuss energy current correlations in thermal equilibrium and point out the linkage to the fluctuating Peierls equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to ICMP 15, Rio de Janeiro, August 2006, 13 pages

entry.title: On the Boltzmann Equation for Weakly Nonlinear Wave Equations
entry.summary: We explain how the kinetic theory of L. Boltzmann is applied to weakly nonlinear wave equations.

entry.title: The one-dimensional Schrödinger-Newton equations
entry.summary: We prove an existence and uniqueness result for ground states of one-dimensional Schr\"{o}dinger-Newton equations.

entry.title: On the ground state of quantum layers
entry.summary: We provide some new results of the ground state of quantum layers.

entry.title: Mathematical Modeling of Control Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial mistakes.

entry.title: Counterexamples for the convexity of certain matricial inequalities
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn. We found a mistake in Lemma 4.1

entry.title: Conservation laws for a general Lorentz connection
entry.summary: We derive conservation laws for energy-momentum (canonical and dynamical) and angular momentum for a general Lorentz connection.

entry.title: Piecewise Linear Phase Transitions
entry.summary: It is shown how simple assumptions lead to piecewise linear behavior, which is observed in certain phase transitions.

entry.title: On stable determination of potential by boundary measurements
entry.summary: We give new stability estimates for the Gel'fand-Calderon inverse boundary value problem

entry.title: C*-Algebras Generated by Partial Isometries
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize the C*-Algebra generated by partial isometries.

entry.title: A class of exactly solvable Schroedinger equation with moving boundary conditions
entry.summary: Using first and second order supersymmetry formalism we obtain a class of exactly solvable potentials subject to moving boundary conditions.

entry.title: Remarks on the Friedman equations
entry.summary: We give some heuristic results for FRW situations with Ricci flow.

entry.title: Borg type uniqueness Theorems for periodic Jacobi operators with matrix valued coefficients
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of Borg type uniqueness Theorems for periodic Jacobi operators with matrix valued coefficients.

entry.title: Classical and quantum integrability
entry.summary: We give a sufficient condition for quantising integrable systems.

entry.title: Attractors for a deconvolution model of turbulence
entry.summary: We consider a deconvolution model for 3D periodic flows. We show the existence of a global attractor for the model.

entry.title: Group Classification of Burgers' Equations
entry.summary: In this work we carry out a complete group classification of Burgers' equations.

entry.title: Geometric Characterization of Solitons
entry.summary: I show that $H^1$ solutions of the nonlinear Schroedinger equation which are incoming converge to a soliton, in the radial case.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Comm in PDE

entry.title: A generalization of Cachazo-Douglas-Seiberg-Witten conjecture for symmetric spaces
entry.summary: We extend the original Cachazo-Douglas-Seiberg-Witten conjecture for symmetric spaces.

entry.title: A note on Stormer condition for decomposability of positive maps
entry.summary: We present a partial characterization of matrices in $M_n(\cA)^+$ satisfying the St{\o}rmer condition.

entry.title: More on the quantum potential
entry.summary: A possible thermalization of Fisher information is suggested for certain situations.

entry.title: Remarks on Fisher information
entry.summary: Some situations are discussed where subquantum oscillations in momentum arise in connectiion with Fisher information and the quantum potential.

entry.title: Electromagnetic fields from contact forms
entry.summary: In this short note we prove that every contact form on a 3-manifold M induces a solution to Maxwell's equations on M.

entry.title: An Upper Bound on the critical density for Activated Random Walks on Euclidean Lattices
entry.summary: We show the critical density for activated random walks on Euclidean lattices is at most one.

entry.title: Sur les formules locales de l'indice
entry.summary: We review some facts about bivariant Chern characters in Noncommutative Geometry and anomaly formulas in Quantum Field Theory.

entry.title: Some Integrals of the Dedekind Eta-function
entry.summary: This note presents selected values of definite integrals whose integrand contains a power of the Dedekind function having imaginary argument.

entry.title: Pendulum Integration and Elliptic Functions
entry.summary: Revisiting canonical integration of the classical pendulum around its unstable equilibrium, normal hyperbolic canonical coordinates are constructed

entry.title: Échelles de temps pour l'évolution quantique à petite constante de Planck
entry.summary: We present some recent results concerning the long time semiclassical approximation .

entry.title: Two-dimensional Ricci flow as a stochastic process
entry.summary: We prove that, for a two-dimensional Riemannian manifold, the Ricci flow is obtained by a Wiener process.

entry.title: Lifting Frenet Formulas
entry.summary: In this study, we conclude the vertical, complete and horizontal lifts of Frenet formulas given by (1) and defined on space R3 to its tangent space TR3 = R6.

entry.title: Hamilton Dynamics on Clifford Kaehler Manifolds
entry.summary: This paper presents Hamilton dynamics on Clifford Kaeler manifolds. In the end, the some results related to Clifford Kaehler dynamical systems are also discussed.

entry.title: Remarks on Robin's and Niocolas Inequalities
entry.summary: Robin's Conjecture is strengthened, deformed, and proved. Nicolas conjecture follows.

entry.title: On the N-dimensional hydrogen atom in momentum representation
entry.summary: We derive the wave function for N-dimensional hydrogen atom in the momentum representation with the phase factor using the generating function method and Hankel's integral.

entry.title: Cremmer-Gervais Quantum Lie Algebra
entry.summary: We describe a quantum Lie algebra based on the Cremmer-Gervais R-matrix. The algebra arises upon a restriction of an infinite-dimensional quantum Lie algebra.

entry.title: Superintegrable non-autonomous Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: The Mishenko-Fomenko theorem on action-angle coordinates for superintegrable autonomous Hamiltonian systems is extended to the non-autonomous ones.

entry.title: Extension d'une classe d'unicite pour les equations de Navier-Stokes
entry.summary: We extend a new uniqueness result recently proved by Q. Chen, C. Miao and Z. Zhang.

entry.title: Split octonions and Maxwell equations
entry.summary: A formulation of the Maxwell equations in terms of the split octonions is presented.

entry.title: Une vue panoramique sur l'analyse semi-classique
entry.summary: In this article we give a panoramic view on semi-classical analysis.

entry.title: An Asymptotic relation for Hadjicostas Formula
entry.summary: We derive an asymptotic formula which in some cases generalize Hadjicostas formula

entry.title: Brief Research Notes on Transformation of Series and Special Functions
entry.summary: In this work we derive results concerning Elliptic Functions using as tools general formulas from previus work.

entry.title: Poincaré invariant quantum theory, J. Lab lectures
entry.summary: Lectures on Poincare invariant quantum theory presented at TJNAF.

entry.title: Supertranslations to all orders
entry.summary: The transformation laws of the general linear superfield and chiral superfields under N=1 supertranslations are tabulated to all orders in the supertranslation parameters.

entry.title: An urn model associated with the Jacobi polynomials
entry.summary: We consider an urn model leading to a random walk that can be solved explicitly in terms of the well known Jacobi polynomials.

entry.title: Determinantal point processes
entry.summary: We present a list of algebraic, combinatorial, and analytic mechanisms that give rise to determinantal point processes.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a contribution to the Oxford Handbook of Random Matrix Theory

entry.title: The Efimov's effect for the Fridrix's model
entry.summary: We study existance of infinitely many egenvalues of the Fridrix's model.

entry.title: The Simple Nonpolar Continuum Media. Part III. the Asymmetric Elasticity (N=2)
entry.summary: The nonclassical model of elasticity was presented

entry.title: The group of causal automorphisms
entry.summary: The group of causal automorphisms on Minkowski space-time is given and its structure is analyzed.

entry.title: Holographic formula for $Q$-curvature. II
entry.summary: We extend the holographic formula for the critical $Q$-curvature to all $Q$-curvatures.

entry.title: Ergodicity of Two Dimensional Turbulence
entry.summary: We review the work of Hairer and Mattingly on ergodicity of two dimensional Navier-Stokes dynamics and discuss some open mathematical problems in the theory of 2d turbulence.

entry.title: Random integral currents
entry.summary: For nice functions, invariant means over integral currents (certain generalized surfaces), can be uniquely defined.

entry.title: Integrality Properties of Open-Closed Mirror Maps
entry.summary: We propose a conjecture on integrality property of the open-closed mirror maps of compact Calabi-Yau manifolds. Some examples are presented.

entry.title: Stringy mirror symmetry
entry.summary: We prove that the mirror pairs constructed by Batyrev and Borisov have stringy mirror symmetry.

entry.title: Remarks on gravity and quantum mechanics
entry.summary: Some relations between conformal relativity and Weyl-Dirac theory are rephrased and clarified.

entry.title: Local unitary equivalence and distinguishability of arbitrary multipartite pure states
entry.summary: We give an universal algorithm for testing the local unitary equivalence of states for multipartite system with arbitrary dimensions.

entry.title: A Spacetime for SU(N)
entry.summary: The rotations, boosts, and translations in an N^2-dimensional spacetime are shown to be related to the fundamental commutators, anticommutators, and Clebsch-Gordan coefficients, respectively, of SU(N).

entry.title: Golden-Thompson from Davis
entry.summary: We give a very short proof of the Golden-Thompson inequality

entry.title: Critical phenomena in the Dyson hierarchical model and renormalization group
entry.summary: We review some results on the critical phenomena in the Dyson hierarchical model and renormalization group.

entry.title: A generalization of the inequality of Audenaert et al
entry.summary: We extend the inequality of Audenaert et al to general von Neumann algebras.

entry.title: Irreversibility and maximum generation in $κ$-generalized statistical mechanics
entry.summary: Irreversibility and maximum generation in $\kappa$-generalized statistical mechanics

entry.title: A General Integral Identity
entry.summary: A family of general integral identities is derived and several applications of physical interest are presented

entry.title: Generators of simple Lie superalgebras in characteristic 0
entry.summary: It is shown that any finite dimensional simple Lie superalgebra over an algebraically closed field of characteristic 0 is generated by 2 elements.

entry.title: Calculation of tunneling rates across a barrier with continuous potential
entry.summary: Here, approximate, but accurate expressions for calculation of wavefunctions and tunneling rates are obtained using the method of uniform asymptotic expansion.

entry.title: Pentagon Identity Revisited I
entry.summary: This is to present a previously overlooked q-analog of the five-term dilogarithm relation.

entry.title: Unified Analytic Electron Interaction Integrals Over Slater Orbitals for Diatomic Molecules
entry.summary: A unified formula for analytical evaluation of two-center exchange, hybrid and coulombic type integrals is presented.

entry.title: Evolution of simple configurations of gravitating gas
entry.summary: We considered the dynamics of gravitating gas - a continuous media with peculiar properties. The exact solutions of its Euler equations for simple initial conditions is obtained.

entry.title: An index 2F2 hypergeometric transform
entry.summary: We construct a new one-parameter family of index hypergeometric transforms associated with the relativistic pseudoharmonic oscillator by using coherent states analysis.

entry.title: Topics on Hamiltonian Mechanics
entry.summary: We modify Hamiltonian mechanics. We reformulate the law of conservation of energy.

entry.title: Bäcklund--Darboux transformations of traslationally shape-invariant potentials
entry.summary: Article withdrawn
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn because of existence of a completely different version, with different title

entry.title: Limit Theorems for the Disordered Quantum Walk
entry.summary: We study the disordered quantum walk in one dimension, and obtain the weak limit theorem.

entry.title: Eigenforms and Quantum Physics
entry.summary: This essay is a discussion of Heinz von Foerster's concept of eigenform and its relationship with the foundations of physics.

entry.title: Recent results in semiclassical approximation with rough potentials
entry.summary: This is an extended abstract for the conference "Microlocal2011 : Microlocal Methods in Mathematical Physics and Global Analysis Universit\"at T\"ubingen, June 14 - 18, 2011"

entry.title: The spectral action for sub-Dirac operators
entry.summary: In this paper, for foliations with spin leaves, we compute the spectral action for sub-Dirac operators.

entry.title: Thermodynamics and scale relativity
entry.summary: It is shown how the fractal paths of scale relativity (following Nottale) can be introduced into a thermodynamical context (following Asadov-Kechkin).

entry.title: On Distribution of Zeros of Some Quazipolynoms
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate distribution of zeros for only quasipolynom and obtain exactly lower-bound for their modulus.

entry.title: $λ$-symmetries and Jacobi Last Multiplier
entry.summary: We show that $\lambda$-symmetries can be algorithmically obtained by using the Jacobi last multiplier. Several examples are provided.

entry.title: One-dimensional mechanical networks and crystals
entry.summary: We prove thermal expansion and Hooke-s law for crystals via an one-dimensional microscopic model.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Moscow Math. Journal, 2006, v. 6, No. 2, pp. 353-358

entry.title: Nambu-Poisson dynamics with some applications
entry.summary: Short introduction in NPD with several applications to (in)finite dimensional problems of mechanics, hydrodynamics, M-theory and quanputing is given.

entry.title: Bounded States of One Dimensional Schrodinger Systems
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the existence problem of bound states of one dimensional Schrodinger system via the blow-up method.

entry.title: Stochastic integrability and the KPZ equation
entry.summary: The emerging field of stochastic integrability is outlined.
entry.arxiv:comment: published in IAMP News Bulletin, April 2012

entry.title: Macroscopic fluctuation theory of local collisional dynamics
entry.summary: We explain why the macroscopic fluctuations of deterministic local collision dynamics should be characterized by a non strictly convex functional.

entry.title: On a fractional quantum potential
entry.summary: We use the fractional calculus of Kobelev to produce a fractional quantum potential for a corresponding Schrodinger type equation.

entry.title: A Primer on Differential Forms
entry.summary: This primer is intended as an introduction to differential forms, a central object in modern mathematical physics, for scientists and engineers.

entry.title: On the convergence of cluster expansions
entry.summary: Two theorems on the theory of cluster expansions for an abstract polymer system are reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, Mathematisches Forschungsinstitut Conference, Oberwolfach, Germany, 2001

entry.title: On stationary solutions of two-dimensional Euler Equation
entry.summary: We study the geometry of streamlines and stability properties for steady state solutions of the Euler equations for ideal fluid.

entry.title: Lectures on Topos Quantum Theory
entry.summary: This is a series of lecture notes explaining topos theory and its application in physics.

entry.title: Relativistic Orbits and the Zeros of $\wp(Θ)$
entry.summary: A simple expression for the zeros of Weierstrass' function is given which follows from a formula for relativistic orbits.

entry.title: Erratum to: From Uncertainty Principles to Wegner Estimates
entry.summary: Erratum to "From Uncertainty Principles to Wegner Estimates".

entry.title: An Analytical Solution To A Special Case Of The Weber-Schafheitlin Integral
entry.summary: Special cases of Weber-Schafheitlin type integrals are evaluated analytically.

entry.title: A Note on Twistor Integrals
entry.summary: An exposition of the basic geometry of twistor integrals, intended for mathematicians.

entry.title: Einstein's Special Relativity: The Hyperbolic Geometric Viewpoint
entry.summary: The analytic hyperbolic geometric viewpoint of Einstein's special theory of relativity is presented.

entry.title: On the Hilbert space dimension of systems with second class constraints
entry.summary: It is shown that quantized dynamical system with second class constraints has infinite dimensional Hilbert space.

entry.title: Case's Eigenvalues by Markel's Matrix
entry.summary: A method of computing Case's eigenvalues is proposed. The eigenvalues are obtained as eigenvalues of a tridiagonal matrix.

entry.title: On SUSY curves
entry.summary: In this note we give a summary of some elementary results in the theory of super Riemann surfaces (SUSY curves).

entry.title: Explicit Formula for Witten-Kontsevich Tau-Function
entry.summary: We present an explicit formula for Witten-Kontsevich tau-function.

entry.title: A remark on constrained von Karman theories
entry.summary: We derive the Euler-Lagrange equation corresponding to a variant of non-Euclidean constrained von Karman theories.

entry.title: A new nonlinear generalization of the Dirac equation
entry.summary: We postulate a new nonlinear generalization of the Dirac equation for an electron. Basic properties of the new equation are considered.

entry.title: Quantum Tomography From Few Full-Rank Observables
entry.summary: We establish that the PhaseLift algorithm recovers pure states from a constant number of full-rank observables with high probability.

entry.title: Some Properties of a Class of QM Phase Space Measures
entry.summary: We have a look at the probability measures induced by Schrodinger wave functions on phase space.

entry.title: Wavelets in field theory
entry.summary: We discuss the use of Daubechies wavelets in discretizing quantum field theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, for proceedings of light cone 2013, Skiathos, Greece

entry.title: Quasisolution of the inverse 3D aerohydrodynamics problem
entry.summary: In the article we generalise the quasisolution approach to the planar aerohydrodynamics problems to 3D case. We search for solution in the form of the linear spline.

entry.title: Applications of the Thick Distributional Calculus
entry.summary: We give several applications of the thick distributional calculus. We consider homogeneous distributions, point source fields, and higher order derivatives of order $0.$

entry.title: Resolvent estimates for the magnetic Schrodinger operator
entry.summary: We prove optimal high-frequency resolvent estimates for perturbations by large magnetic and electric potentials

entry.title: Symmetry problem
entry.summary: A novel approach to an old symmetry problem is developed. A new proof is given for the following symmetry problem, studied earlier.

entry.title: Liouville theorem for Beltrami flow
entry.summary: We prove that the Beltrami flow of ideal fluid in $R^3$ of a finite energy is zero.

entry.title: Mathematical Caricature of Large Waves
entry.summary: The Kadomtsev-Petviiashvili equation is considered as a mathematical caricature of large and rogue waves.

entry.title: Zero modes for the quantum Liouville model
entry.summary: The problem of definition of zero modes for quantum Liouville model is discussed and corresponding Hilbert space representation is constructed.

entry.title: Adiabatics using quantum action
entry.summary: For slow--fast quantum systems, we compute first corrections to the quantum action and to the effective slow Hamiltonian.

entry.title: Hilbert schemes and multiple q-zeta values
entry.summary: We present several conjectures on multiple q-zeta values and on the role they play in certain problems of enumerative geometry.

entry.title: K- causality and domain theory
entry.summary: We prove that a certain type of stably causal space times are bi continuous posets.

entry.title: On the symmetries of a Rikitake type system
entry.summary: A symplectic realization and some symmetries of a Rikitake type system are presented.

entry.title: Comment on "Classical Mechanics of Nonconservative Systems"
entry.summary: A Comment on the Letter by C. R. Galley, Phys. Rev. Lett. 110, 174301 (2013).

entry.title: A. Cormack's last inversion formula and a FBP reconstruction
entry.summary: A reconstruction of a function from integrals over the family of confocal paraboloids is given by a FBP formula.

entry.title: Introduction to the SK model
entry.summary: This is a review paper for the "Current Developments in Mathematics 2014" conference.

entry.title: Some notes on Euler products
entry.summary: We focus on a well-known convergence phenomenon, the fact that the $\zeta$ zeros are the universal singularities of certain Euler products.

entry.title: Poisson-Lie T-duality and Courant algebroids
entry.summary: Poisson-Lie T-duality is explained using the language of Courant algebroids.

entry.title: Generating functions of Chebyshev polynomials in three variables
entry.summary: In this paper generating functions of three variables Chebyshev polynomials associated with the root system of $A_3$ Lie algebra are obtained.

entry.title: Nahm's, Basu-Harvey-Terashima's equations and Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: We discuss the correspondence between Nahm's equations, the Basu-Harvey-Terashima equations, and Lie superalgebras.

entry.title: On defocusing coupled nonlinear Schrodinger equations
entry.summary: The initial value problem for some defocusing coupled nonlinear Schrodinger equations is investigated. Global well-posedness and scattering are established.

entry.title: Global Non-perturbative Deformation Quantization of a Poisson Algebra
entry.summary: A proposed definition is given for the quantization of a Poisson algebra, taking the quantum product to be a geodesic on the manifold of associative products.

entry.title: A new solvable many-body problem of goldfish type
entry.summary: A new solvable many-body problem of goldfish type is introduced and the behavior of its solutions is tersely discussed.

entry.title: Fermionic Computations for Integrable Hierarchies
entry.summary: We present a unified fermionic approach to compute the tau-functions and the n-point functions of integrable hierarchies related to some infinite-dimensional Lie algebras and their representations.

entry.title: On the moduli space of Higgs pairs with nilpotent residues
entry.summary: We specify the conjecture about the structure of the Coulomb branch of N=2 supersymmetric quantum field theories in four dimensions.

entry.title: WDVV Equations
entry.summary: The paper aims to point out a novel geometric characterisation of the WDVV equations of 2D topological field theory.

entry.title: Haantjes Manifolds and Veselov Systems
entry.summary: A novel geometric interpretation of the solutions of the WDVV equations formerly found by A.P. Veselov is suggested.

entry.title: Tensor fields defined by Lax representations
entry.summary: In this paper, some properties of tensor fields constructed by the Lax representation of chiral-type systems are investigated.

entry.title: Frobenius Manifolds, Spectral Curves, and Integrable Hierarchies
entry.summary: We formulate some conjectures that relates semisimple Frobenius manifolds, their spectral curves and integrable hierarchies.

entry.title: Remarks on the inhomogeneous fractional nonlinear Schrodinger equation
entry.summary: Using a sharp Gagliardo-Nirenberg type inequality, well-posedness issues of the initial value problem for a fractional inhomogeneous Schrodinger equation are investigated.

entry.title: Towards theory of C-symmetries
entry.summary: The concept of C-symmetry originally appeared in PT-symmetric quantum mechanics is studied within the Krein spaces framework.

entry.title: On continuous causal isomorphisms
entry.summary: It is shown that continuous causal isomorphisms on two-dimensional Minkowski spacetime can be characterized by the invariance of wave equations.

entry.title: Reconstruction of colourings without freezing
entry.summary: We prove that reconstruction in the $k$-colouring model occurs strictly below the threshold for freezing for large $k$.

entry.title: On the asymptotic behavior of Bessel-like diffusions
entry.summary: We derive the asymptotic behavior of the transition probability density of the Bessel-like diffusions for "dimension" $\rho = 0$.

entry.title: Analysis of Dirichlet forms on graphs
entry.summary: In this thesis, we study connections between metric and combinatorial graphs from a Dirichlet space point of view.

entry.title: Crystals in the Void
entry.summary: We study the problem of the crystal formation in the vacuum.

entry.title: Comment on "Spinon Attraction in Spin-1/2 Antiferromagnetic Chains"
entry.summary: Comment on B.A. Bernevig, D. Giuliano, and R.B. Laughlin, Phys. Rev. Lett. 86, 3392 (2001).

entry.title: Réflexions sur la question fréquentielle en traitement du signal
entry.summary: New definitions are suggested for frequencies which may be instantaneous or not. The Heisenberg-Gabor inequality and the Shannon sampling theorem are briefly discussed.

entry.title: Nonlinear Lagrangians of the Ricci type
entry.summary: The Euler-Lagrange equations for some class of gravitational actions are calculated by means of Palatini principle. Polynomial structures with Einstein metrics appear among extremals of this variational problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages in LaTeX, to appear in Reports on Mathematical Physics

entry.title: The Relativistic Transformation to Rotating Frames
entry.summary: We present a critical review of the relativistic rotation transformation of Trocheris and Takeno. A new transformation is proposed which is free from the drawbacks of the former. Some applications are presented.

entry.title: The Cauchy Problem for the Wave Equation in the Schwarzschild Geometry
entry.summary: The Cauchy problem is considered for the scalar wave equation in the Schwarzschild geometry. We derive an integral spectral representation for the solution and prove pointwise decay in time.

entry.title: A Speculative Approach to Quantum Gravity
entry.summary: The bare bones of a theory of quantum gravity are exposed. It may have the potential to solve the cosmological constant problem. Less certain is its behavior in the Newtonian limit.

entry.title: BRS-Chern-Simons forms and cyclic homology
entry.summary: We use some BRS techniques to construct Chern-Simons forms generalizing the Chern character of K_1 groups in the Cuntz-Quillen description of cyclic homology.

entry.title: John Bell's Observations on the Chiral Anomaly and Some Properties of Its Descendants
entry.summary: John Bell's emphasis of the essential ambiguities in anomaly calculations is recalled. Some descendants of the anomaly are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, LaTeX, talk presented at the Bell Memorial Meeting, Vienna, Austria, November 2000

entry.title: Cohomology of the variational complex in BRST theory
entry.summary: We show that cohomology of the variational complex in field-antifield BRST theory on an arbitrary manifold is equal to the de Rham cohomology of this manifold.

entry.title: The 8k-3 Instanton
entry.summary: We give an explicit parameterization of the general 8k -3 instanton.

entry.title: Dirac's Magnetic Monopoles (Again)
entry.summary: Dirac's quantization of magnetic monopole strength is derived without reference to a (singular, patched) vector potential.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages; 2 figures; talk prepared for Dirac Memorial, Tallahassee, Florida, December 2002; email correspondence to jackiw@lns.mit.edu

entry.title: The BRST extension of gauge non-invariant Lagrangians
entry.summary: We show that, in gauge theory of principal connections, any gauge non-invariant Lagrangian can be completed to the BRST-invariant one. The BRST extension of the global Chern-Simons Lagrangian is present.

entry.title: Topological Aspects of Gauge Theories
entry.summary: To appear in Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, published by Elsevier in early 2006. Comments/corrections welcome. The article surveys topological aspects in gauge theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 23 pages, 2 figures, to appear in Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics in 2006

entry.title: BF system - encyclopedic entry
entry.summary: The notion of the BF (topological) gauge field theory is defined.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: 'Concise Encyclopedia of Supersymmetry And Noncommutative Structures in Mathematics and Physics', Duplij, S.; Siegel, Warren; Bagger, Jonathan (Eds.), 2005, pages 53-54

entry.title: Green function identities in Euclidean quantum field theory
entry.summary: Given a generic Lagrangian system of even and odd fields, we show that any infinitesimal transformation of its classical Lagrangian yields the identities which Euclidean Green functions of quantum fields satisfy.

entry.title: Odd Nambu bracket on Grassmann algebra
entry.summary: The Grassmann-odd Nambu bracket on the Grassmann algebra is proposed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 5 pages, JHEP3.cls format. Correction of misprints

entry.title: Nambu-like odd bracket on Grassmann algebra
entry.summary: The Grassmann-odd Nambu-like bracket corresponding to an arbitrary Lie algebra and realized on the Grassmann algebra is proposed.

entry.title: Determinant formulas for the $τ$-functions of the Painlevé equations of type $A$
entry.summary: Explicit determinant formulas are presented for the $\tau$ functions of the generalized Painlev\'e equations of type $A$. This result allows an interpretation of the $\tau$-functions as the Pl\"ucker coordinates of the universal Grassmann manifold.

entry.title: Higher order Painlevé equations of type $A^{(1)}_l$
entry.summary: A series of systems of nonlinear equations with affine Weyl group symmetry of type $A^{(1)}_l$ is studied. This series gives a generalization of Painlev\'e equations $P_{IV}$ and $P_{V}$ to higher orders.

entry.title: Charged Quantum Fields Associated with Endomorphisms of CAR and CCR Algebras
entry.summary: Quasi-free endomorphisms of the CAR and CCR algebras are studied from the point of view of the theory of superselection sectors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 111 pages, no figures; the author's PhD thesis in physics

entry.title: Center and Universal R-matrix for Quantized Borcherds Superalgebras
entry.summary: We construct a nondegenerate symmetric bilinear form on quantized enveloping algebras associated to Borcherds superalgebras. With this, we study its center and its universal R-matrix.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages, figures drawn with the "texdraw" package

entry.title: Meromorphic braided category arising in quantum affine algebras
entry.summary: We construct a category of flat vector bundles on an elliptic curve. It arises in the representation theory of quantum affine algebras and carries meromorphic braided structure with singularities on the diagonal of the square of the curve.

entry.title: Special Lagrangian Tori on a Borcea-Voisin Threefold
entry.summary: We show the existence of special Lagrangian tori on one family of Borcea-Voisin threefolds. We also construct a family of special Lagrangian submanifolds on the total space of the canonical line bundle of projective spaces.

entry.title: GG-functions and their relations to A-hypergeometric functions
entry.summary: We describe a new approach to the notion of general hypergeometric functions

entry.title: Limit Theorems for Motions in a Flow with a Nonzero Drift
entry.summary: We establish diffusion and fractional Brownian motion approximations for motions in a Markovian Gaussian random field with a nonzero mean.

author.name: Albert Fannjiang
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, University of California, Davis

author.name: Tomasz Komorowski
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Mathemathics, Maria Curie-Skłodowska University, Lublin

entry.title: Discrete Growth Models
entry.summary: Part I of the thesis gives a complete analysis of gaps in a one-dimensional creation-annihilation model. Part II contains a proof of the existence of infinitely many holes in the two-dimensional DLA cluster.

entry.title: Generalized Riemann - Liouville fractional derivatives for multifractal sets
entry.summary: The Riemann-Liouville fractional integrals and derivatives are generalized for cases when fractional exponent $d$ are functions of space and times coordinates (i.e. $d=d({\bf r}(t),t)$).

entry.title: Dynamical systems admitting the normal shift
entry.summary: Development of theory of dynamical systems admitting the normal shift in 1993-1999 is reviewed. Basics are given with complete proofs.
entry.arxiv:comment: Thesis for the degree of Doctor of Sciences in Russia, AmSTeX, 219 pages

entry.title: Exponentially decaying eigenvectors for certain almost periodic operators
entry.summary: For certain one-dimensional Schroedinger-type difference operators with a complex potential, a "complete" set of exponentially decaying eigenvectors is shown to exist. "Completeness" entails that the parameters involved are obtained through evaluation of analytic functions on a Riemann surface.

entry.title: A fixed point formula for loop group actions
entry.summary: We express the index of the Dirac operator on symplectic quotients of a Hamiltonian loop group manifold with proper moment map in terms of fixed point data.

entry.title: Edge Effects on Local Statistics in Lattice Dimers: A Study of the Aztec Diamond (Finite Case)
entry.summary: We compute the probability of any local pattern at an arbitrary position in a random dimer configuration in a square grid with an Aztec-diamond boundary.

entry.title: Stationary random fields with linear regressions
entry.summary: We analyze certain stationary fields with linear regressions and quadratic conditional variances. This classic probabilistic problem leads somewhat unexpectedly to stationary Markov processes closely tied to non-commutative probability through the q-Hermite polynomials.

entry.title: Gel'fand-Dorfman Bialgebras
entry.summary: This is a survey talk on the study of Gel'fand-Dorfman bialgebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, Latex file. A talk given in the workshop on Algebra and Discrete Mathematics at The Chinese University of Hong Kong, 27-31 March 2000

entry.title: Two-dimensional dynamical systems admitting the normal shift
entry.summary: Two-dimensional case in the theory of dynamical systems admitting the normal shift differs crucially from multidimensional case. Features of two-dimensional case are gathered and studied in this thesis.
entry.arxiv:comment: Thesis for the degree of Candidate of Sciences in Russia

entry.title: Classification of infinite dimensional weight modules over the Lie superalgebra $sl(2/1)$
entry.summary: We give a classification of infinite dimensional indecomposable weight modules over the Lie superalgebra $sl(2/1)$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, Latex, to appear in Comm. Alg

entry.title: Special functions, conformal blocks, Bethe ansatz, and SL(3,Z)
entry.summary: This is the talk of the second author at the meeting "Topological Methods in Physical Sciences", London, November 2000. We review our work on KZB equations.

entry.title: On first exit times for homogeneous diffusion processes
entry.summary: It is given an effective upper estimate of expectation of |T_1-T_2|, where T_1 and T_2 are the first exit times from a region for two vector diffusion processes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theory of Probability and Its Application, 1987, v.31, No 3, pp.497-498

entry.title: Vertex Lie algebras, vertex Poisson algebras and vertex algebras
entry.summary: The notions of vertex Lie algebra and vertex Poisson algebra are presented and connections among vertex Lie algebras, vertex Poisson algebras and vertex algebras are discussed.

entry.title: Non Parallelism of Ricci tensor of Pseudo-cylindric Metrics
entry.summary: We descrive examples of metrics in the conformal class $[g]$ on complete conformally flat Riemannian manifolds $(M,g].$ These metrics have a constant scalar curvature and an harmonic curvature with non parallel Ricci tensor.

entry.title: Scalar--Flat Lorentzian Einstein--Weyl Spaces
entry.summary: We find all three-dimensional Einstein--Weyl spaces with the vanishing scalar curvature

entry.title: Characterizations of the automorphisms of Hilbert space effect algebras
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize the automorphisms of Hilbert space effect algebras by means of their preserving properties which concern certain relations and quantities appearing in quantum measurement theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages. To appear in Commun. Math. Phys

entry.title: Exchange relations of Level-two vertex operators of $U_q(\hat{sl_2})$
entry.summary: We calculate the exchange relations of vertex operators of $U_q(\hat{sl_2})$ at level-two from its bosonic realization. The corresponding invertibility relation of type I vertex operators is also studied.

entry.title: Quantum Langlands duality and mirror symmetry
entry.summary: We show that (quantum) D-modules of Givental type on affine flag varieties are transformed to D-modules of Beilinson-Drinfeld type on $n$-reduced Sato Grassmannians via affine Miura transformation.

entry.title: Special Kaehler manifolds: a survey
entry.summary: This is a survey of recent contributions to the area of special Kaehler geometry. It is based on lectures given at the 21st Winter School on Geometry and Physics held in Srni in January 2001.

entry.title: Birkhoff Normal Forms in Semi-Classical Inverse Problems
entry.summary: We apply recent results on semi-classical trace formulae and on Birkhoff normal forms for semi-classical Fourier integral operators to a wide range of semi-classical and high energy spectral inverse problems.

entry.title: Some upper bounds on the number of resonances for manifolds with infinite cylindrical ends
entry.summary: We prove some sharp upper bounds on the number of resonances associated with the Laplacian, or Laplacian plus potential, on a manifold with infinite cylidrical ends.

entry.title: Identities and derivations for Jacobian algebras
entry.summary: Constructions of n-Lie algebras by strong n-Lie-Poisson algebras are given. First cohomology groups of adjoint module of Jacobian algebras are calculated. Minimal identities of 3-Jacobian algebra are found.

entry.title: A note on $H^1(Emb(M,N))$
entry.summary: Aim of this note is to extract cohomological information about the manifold $Emb(M,N)$ from the topology of the target manifold N. For special conditions, a monomorphism $H^1 (N) \to H^1 (Emb(M,N))$ is constructed.

entry.title: Weyl algebra modules
entry.summary: We investigate weight modules for finite and infinite Weyl algebras, classifying all such simple modules. We also study the representation type of the blocks of locally-finite weight module categories and describe indecomposable modules in tame blocks.

entry.title: A self-avoiding walk with attractive interactions
entry.summary: A self-avoiding walk with small attractive interactions is described here. The existence of the connective constant is established, and the diffusive behavior is proved using the method of the lace expansion.

entry.title: Lie Superalgebras Graded by the Root System $A(m,n)$
entry.summary: We determine the Lie superalgebras that are graded by the root systems of the basic classical simple Lie superalgebras of type A$(m,n)$.

entry.title: Isospectral Theory of Euler Equations
entry.summary: Isospectral problem of both 2D and 3D Euler equations of inviscid fluids, is investigated. Connections with the Clay problem are described. Spectral theorem of the Lax pair is studied.

entry.title: Zeros of Chromatic and Flow Polynomials of Graphs
entry.summary: We survey results and conjectures concerning the zero distribution of chromatic and flow polynomials of graphs, and characteristic polynomials of matroids.
entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages, corrected statement of Theorem 34 and some typos

entry.title: Recurrence and lyapunov exponents
entry.summary: We prove two inequalities between the Lyapunov exponents of a diffeomorphism and its local recurrence properties. We give examples showing that each of the inequalities is optimal.

entry.title: The Legacy of the IST
entry.summary: We provide a brief review of some of the major research results arising from the method of the Inverse Scattering Transform.

entry.title: Two applications of instanton numbers
entry.summary: The two applications are: 1. sometimes instanton numbers stratify moduli of bundles better than Chern numbers. 2. sometimes instanton numbers distinguish singularities better than the classical numerical invariants.

entry.title: A Physicist's Proof of the Lagrange-Good Multivariable Inversion Formula
entry.summary: We provide yet another proof of the classical Lagrange-Good multivariable inversion formula using techniques of quantum field theory.

entry.title: Convergent star product algebras on "ax+b"
entry.summary: We define non-tempered (exponential growth) function spaces on the Lie group ax+b which are stable under some left-invariant (convergent) star product.

entry.title: Limit Theorem for Sums of Random Products
entry.summary: We study a generalization of the Random Energy Model to the case when the number of exponential factors varies at random. Also a relation between REM and the Erd"os-R'enyi limit theorem for maximums of partial sums is considered.

entry.title: On representations of braid groups determined by directed graphs
entry.summary: We show that the two coproducts of a Markov $L$-coalgebra yield at least two solutions of the Yang-Baxter equation and thus at least two representations of braid groups.

entry.title: The Liouville-Arnold-Nekhoroshev theorem for non-compact invariant manifolds
entry.summary: Under ceratin conditions, generalized action-angle coordinates can be introduced near non-compact invariant manifolds of completely and partially integrable Hamiltonian systems.

entry.title: The Garden of Quantum Spheres
entry.summary: A list of known quantum spheres of dimension one, two and three is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in: Banach Center Publications

entry.title: From entangled codipterous coalgebras to coassociative manifolds
entry.summary: We construct from coassociative coalgebras, bialgebras, Hopf algebras, new objects such as Poisson algebras, Leibniz algebras defined by J-L Loday and M. Ronco and explore the notion of coassociative manifolds.

entry.title: Existence of Chaos in Evolution Equations
entry.summary: For a general evolution equation with a Silnikov homoclinic orbit, Smale horseshoes are constructed.

entry.title: An affine framework for analytical mechanics
entry.summary: An affine Cartan calculus is developed. The concepts of special affine bundles and special affine duality are introduced. The canonical isomorphisms, fundamental for Lagrangian and Hamiltonian formulations of the dynamics in the affine setting are proved.

entry.title: Differential equations and conformal field theories
entry.summary: We discuss the recent results of the author on the existence of systems of differential equations for chiral genus-zero and genus-one correlation functions in conformal field theories.

entry.title: A new cohomology theory associated to deformations of Lie algebra morphisms
entry.summary: We introduce a new cohomology theory related to deformations of Lie algebra morphisms. This notion involves simultaneous deformations of two Lie algebras and a homomorphism between them.

author.name: Yael Fregier
author.arxiv:affiliation: Centre de Physique Theorique de Luminy

entry.title: Fock space representations and crystal bases for $C_n^{(1)}$
entry.summary: We describe the Fock space representations and crystal bases for the affine Kac-Moody Lie algebra of type $C_n^{(1)}$ in terms of coloured Young diagrams.

entry.title: Remark on some conformally invariant integral equations: the method of moving spheres
entry.summary: We study some conformally invariant integral equations using the method of moving spheres.

entry.title: Contributions to the Theory of the Barnes Function
entry.summary: This paper presents a family of new integral representations and asymptotic series of the multiple gamma function. The numerical schemes for high-precision computation of the Barnes gamma function and Glaisher's constant are also discussed.

entry.title: Symmetric functions and random partitions
entry.summary: These are (not updated) notes from the lectures I gave at the NATO ASI ``Symmetric Functions 2001'' at the Isaac Newton Institute in Cambridge (June 25 -- July 6, 2001). Their goal is an informal introduction to asymptotic combinatorics related to partitions.

entry.title: Dispersive analysis of the charge transfer models
entry.summary: We prove the dispersive estimates for charge transfer Hamiltonians, including the matrix non-selfadjoint generalizations. The charge transfer models appear naturally in the study of stability of multi-soliton systems.

entry.title: Modular invariants and their fusion rules
entry.summary: The subfactor approach to modular invariants gives insight into the fusion rule structure of the modular invariants.

entry.title: Sturm Oscillation and Comparison Theorems
entry.summary: This is a celebratory and pedagogical discussion of Sturm oscillation theory. Included is the discussion of the difference equation case via determinants and a renormalized oscillation theorem of Gesztesy, Teschl, and the author.

entry.title: Analogs of the M-Function in the Theory of Orthogonal Polynomials on the Unit Circle
entry.summary: We show that the multitude of applications of the Weyl-Titchmarsh m-function leads to a multitude of different functions in the theory of orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle that serve as analogs of the m-function.

entry.title: Construction of Nijenhuis operators and dendriform trialgebras
entry.summary: Nijenhuis operators are constructed from particular bialgebras called dendriform- Nijenhuis bialgebras. It turns out that such operators commute with TD-operators, kind of Baxter-Rota operators, and therefore closely related to dendriform trialgebras. Examples are given.

entry.title: Ground State Incongruence In 2D Spin Glasses Revisited
entry.summary: A construction supporting a conjecture that different ground state pairs exist in the 2-dimensional Edwards-Anderson Ising spin glass is presented.

entry.title: Rotor interaction in the annulus billiard
entry.summary: Introducing the rotor interaction in the integrable system of the annulus billiard produces a variety of dynamical phenomena, from integrability to ergodicity.

entry.title: Boundary spectral behaviour for semiclassical operators in one dimension
entry.summary: For a class of non-selfadjoint semiclassical operators in dimension one, we get a complete asymptotic description of all eigenvalues near a critical value of the leading symbol of the operator on the boundary of the pseudospectrum.

entry.title: The non-adiabatic classical geometric phase and its bundle-theoretic interpretation
entry.summary: A bundle theoretic interpretation of the non-adiabatic classical geometric phase is given in the Koopman representation of dynamics

entry.title: Twisted cyclic cohomology of the quantum SU(2)
entry.summary: Withdrawn. Generalized and subsumed by math.QA/0405249
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn. Generalized and subsumed by math.QA/0405249

entry.title: A Remark on Long Range Scattering for the nonlinear Klein-Gordon equation
entry.summary: We consider the problem of scattering for the long range critical nonlinear Klein-Gordon in one space dimension.

entry.title: Integrable Operators and Canonical Differential Systems
entry.summary: In this article we consider a class of integrable operators and investigate its connections with the following theories:the spectral theory of non-self-adjoint operators, the Riemann-Hilbert problem, the canonical differential systems and the random matrices theory.

entry.title: Generating Functions of Random Walks on Graphs
entry.summary: The article provides an explicit algebraic expression for the generating function of walks on graphs. Its proof is based on the scattering theory for the differential Laplace operator on non-compact graphs.

entry.title: Remarks on a paper of Geronimo and Johnson
entry.summary: We present a point of view on results of the paper of Geronimo and Johnson [Comm. Math, Phys. 193 (1998)] that allow infinitely dimensional generalization up to the case when spectrum is supported on a Cantor set of positive Lebesgue measure.

entry.title: Limit periodic Jacobi matrices with a prescribed p-adic hull and a singularly continuous spectrum
entry.summary: In this work we build a certain machine that allows to construct almost periodic Jacobi matrices with singularly continuous spectrum a prescribed p-adic hull.

entry.title: Absolutely continuous spectrum of multidimensional Schrodinger operator
entry.summary: We prove that 3-dimensional Schrodinger operator with slowly decaying potential has an absolutely continuous spectrum that fills the positive half-line. The asymptotics of Green's function is obtained as well.

entry.title: Continuity of the Volume of Simplices in Classical Geometry
entry.summary: It is proved that the volume of spherical or hyperbolic simplices, when considered as a function of the dihedral angles, can be extended continuously to degenerated simplices.

entry.title: Reidemeister torsion of a symplcetic complex
entry.summary: We consider a claim mentioned in \cite{Witten} pp 187 about the relation between a symplectic chain complex with $\omega-$compatible bases and Reidemeister Torsion of it. This is an explanation of it.

entry.title: Dispersive estimates for Schroedinger operators: A survey
entry.summary: We present some old and new results on dispersive estimates for Schroedinger equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: In this new version some more references have been added

entry.title: Stable manifolds for all monic supercritical NLS in one dimension
entry.summary: We show that all supercritical monic focusing NLS in one space dimension exhibit asymptotic stability of perturbed standing waves provided the perturbations are chosen on a small hypersuface in a suitable space.

entry.title: Geometry of Quantum Spheres
entry.summary: Spectral triples on the q-deformed spheres of dimension two and three are reviewed.

entry.title: The maximum entropy state
entry.summary: We give an algorithm for calculating the maximum entropy state as the least fixed point of a Scott continuous mapping on the domain of classical states in their Bayesian order.

entry.title: Tensor functions of tensors and the concept of extended tensor fields
entry.summary: Tensor fields depending on other tensor fields are considered. The concept of extended tensor fields is introduced and the theory of differentiation for such fields is developed.

entry.title: Parallal Spinors on Pseudo-Riemannian SpinC Manifolds
entry.summary: We describe, by their holonomy groups, all simply connected irreducible non-locally symmetric pseudo-Riemannian SpinC manifolds which admit parallel spinors. So we generalise the Riemannian case and the pseudo-Riemannian one.

entry.title: On the adiabatic perturbation theory for systems with impacts
entry.summary: We justify an applicability of the adiabatic perturbation theory for three well known systems with impacts: a ball between two slowly moving walls, a slowly irregular waveguide, and an adiabatic piston.

entry.title: Schrödinger Equation in Phase Space and Deformation Quantization
entry.summary: We justify the relevance of Torres-Vega Schr\"{o}dinger equation in phase space using Stone-von Neumann's theorem, and relate it to deformation quantization.

entry.title: Solutions for Toda systems on Riemann surfaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the solutions of Toda systems on Riemann surface in the critical case, we prove a sufficient condition for the existence of solutions of Toda systems.

entry.title: The variational bicomplex on graded manifolds and its cohomology
entry.summary: Lagrangian formalism on graded manifolds is phrased in terms of the Grassmann-graded variational bicomplex, generalizing the familiar variational bicomplex for even Lagrangian systems on fiber bundles.

entry.title: Edge coloring models and reflection positivity
entry.summary: Solving a conjecture of M. H. Freedman, L. Lov\'asz and A. Schrijver we prove that a graph parameter is edge reflection positive and multiplicative if and only if it can be represented by an edge coloring model.

entry.title: The Donaldson-Thomas invariants under blowups and flops
entry.summary: Using the degeneration formula for Doanldson-Thomas invariants, we proved formulae for blowing up a point and simple flops.

entry.title: A Note on Special Kahler Manifolds
entry.summary: We proved a conjecture of D. Freed that there are no non-trivial complete special Kaehler manifolds.

entry.title: On the Futaki Invariants of Complete Intersections
entry.summary: In this paper, we give an explicit formula for the Futaki invariants of complete intersections. The result is new in the case where the variety is smooth or has orbifold singularities.

entry.title: On the Rigidity of Horizontal Slices
entry.summary: In this paper, we proved a rigidity theorem of the Hodge metric for concave horizontal slices and a local rigidity theorem for the monodromy representation.

entry.title: Integrable Systems and Harmonic Maps into Lie Groups
entry.summary: A study of harmonic maps into Lie groups as a generalisation of the study of other well-known integrable systems, particularly the Toda and self-dual Chern Simons theories.

entry.title: Correctness of the optimal control problems for distributed parameter systems (survey)
entry.summary: Here an original idea is suggested to prove the existence of optimal control for some types of non- linear problems. The obtained results can be considered as individual existence theorems (in some sense).

entry.title: On one inverse problem relatively domain for the plate
entry.summary: Inverse problem relatively domain for the plate under across vibrations is considered. The definition of s-functions is interoduced. The construction for defining of the domain of the plate by given s-functions is offered.

entry.title: A simple invariance theorem
entry.summary: We present a simple extension of Lindeberg's argument for the Central Limit Theorem to get a general invariance result. We apply the technique to prove results from random matrix theory, spin glasses, and maxima of random fields.

entry.title: A priori estimates for solutions of a nonlinear dispersive equation
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error.

entry.title: Spectral Theory and Nonlinear PDE: a Survey
entry.summary: This is a slightly modified version of the survey article. Minor changes to the text and the references have been made.

entry.title: Deformation Quantization on Singular Coadjoint Orbits
entry.summary: Invariant star products are constructed on minimal coadjoint orbits of all the simple Lie algebras. Explicit expressions are given for the generators of the Joseph ideals and the associated infinitesimal characters.

entry.title: The Hamilton-Jacobi equation on Lie affgebroids
entry.summary: The Hamilton-Jacobi equation for a Hamiltonian section on a Lie affgebroid is introduced and some examples are discussed.

entry.title: Conformal equivalent metrics in a plane domain are uniquely determined from travel times
entry.summary: An integral stability estimate is proved for refraction coefficients of two conformal metrics in a plane domain in terms of its travel times. No assumption on absence of conjugate points of geodesics is made.

entry.title: Commutation relationships and curvature spin-tensors for extended spinor connections
entry.summary: Extended spinor connections associated with composite spin-tensorial bundles are considered. Commutation relationships for covariant and multivariate differentiations and corresponding curvature spin-tensors are derived.

entry.title: Entropy production in Gaussian thermostats
entry.summary: We show that an arbitrary Anosov Gaussian thermostat on a surface is dissipative unless the external field has a global potential.

entry.title: On a Generalization of Bernoulli and Euler Polynomials
entry.summary: Universal Bernoulli polynomials are introduced and their number theoretical properties discussed. Generalized Euler polynomials are also proposed.

entry.title: Scattering and small data completeness for the critical nonlinear Schroediger equation
entry.summary: We prove Asymptotic Completeness of one dimensional NLS with long range nonlinearities. We also prove existence and expansion of asymptotic solutions with large data at infinity.

entry.title: Riemann-Hilbert Methods in the Theory of Orthogonal Polynomials
entry.summary: In this paper we describe various applications of the Riemann-Hilbert method to the theory of orthogonal polynomials on the line and on the circle.

entry.title: Supersymmetric vertex algebras
entry.summary: We define and study the structure of SUSY Lie conformal and vertex algebras. This leads to effective rules for computations with superfields.

entry.title: Mickelsson algebras and Zhelobenko operators
entry.summary: We construct a family of automorphisms of Mickelsson algebra, satisfying braid group relations. The construction uses 'Zhelobenko cocycle' and includes the dynamical Weyl group action as a particular case.

entry.title: Parametrization of the isospectral set for the vector-valued Sturm-Liouville problem
entry.summary: We obtain a parametrization of the isospectral set of matrix-valued potentials for the vector-valued Sturm-Liouville problem on a finite interval.

entry.title: Stationary and Nonequilibrium Fluctuations in Boundary Driven Exclusion Processes
entry.summary: We prove nonequilibrium fluctuations for the boundary driven symmetric simple exclusion process. We deduce from this result the stationary fluctuations.

entry.title: A note on H-convergence
entry.summary: We give a criterion for H-convergence of conductivity matrices in terms of ordinary weak convergence of the factors in certain quotient representations of the matrices.

entry.title: Periodic orbits in outer billiards
entry.summary: It is shown that the set of 4-period orbits in outer billiard with piecewise smooth convex boundary has an empty interior, provided that no four corners of the boundary form a parallelogram.

entry.title: The Higher Dimensional Positive Mass Theorem I
entry.summary: We derive the Riemannian Positive Mass theorem in arbitrary dimensions, without any topological constraints. The main new tools are skin structures and surgeries on minimal hypersurfaces.

entry.title: Asymptotic stability of small solitons for 2D Nonlinear Schrödinger equations with potential
entry.summary: We consider asymptotic stability of a small solitary wave to supercritical 2-dimensional nonlinear Schr\"{o}dinger equations $$ iu_t+\Delta u=Vu\pm |u|^{p-1}u \quad\text{for $(x,t)\in\mathbb{R}^2\times\mathbb{R}$,}$$ in the energy class.

entry.title: Asymptotics of the Airy-kernel determinant
entry.summary: The authors use Riemann-Hilbert methods to compute the constant that arises in the asymptotic behavior of the Airy-kernel determinant of random matrix theory.

entry.title: On Decay of Solutions to Nonlinear Scrödinger Equations
entry.summary: We present general results on exponential decay of finite energy solutions to stationary nonlinear Schr\"odinger equations.

entry.title: Localization for the Anderson Model on Trees with Finite Dimensions
entry.summary: We introduce a family of trees that interpolate between the Bethe lattice and $\bbZ$. We prove complete localization for the Anderson model on any member of that family.
