entry.title: Geometric Quantization of Algebraic Reduction
entry.summary: An analogue of geometric quantization of Poisson algebras obtained by algebraic reduction of symmetries is developed. Interpretation of the obtained results and their application to the problem of commutativity of quantization and reduction are given

entry.title: The Edge of the Wedge Theorem for Tempered Ultrahyperfunctions
entry.summary: Withdrawn by author - Superseded by arXiv:0910.5106 [math.FA].

entry.title: Quantum Langlands duality and conformal field theory
entry.summary: V. Drinfeld proposed conjectures on geometric Langlands correspondence and its quantum deformation. We refine these conjectures and propose their relationship with algebraic conformal field theory.

entry.title: Finsleroid--Finsler Parallelism
entry.summary: The Finsleroid--induced scalar product, and hence the angle, proves to remain unchanged under the Finsleroid--type parallel transportation of involved vectors in the Landsberg case. The two--vector extension of the Finsleroid metric tensor is proposed.

entry.title: Regularity criteria in weak spaces for Navier-Stokes equations in R3
entry.summary: In this paper we establish a Serrin type regularity criterion on the gradient of pressure in weak spaces for the Leray-Hopf weak solutions of the Navier-Stokes equations in R3.

entry.title: On the Dirichlet problem of Landau-Lifshitz-Maxwell equations
entry.summary: We prove the existence and uniqueness of non-trivial stable solutions to Landau-Lifshitz-Maxwell equations with Dirichlet boundary condition for large anisotropies and small domains, where the domains are non-simply connected.

entry.title: On a distribution in frequency probability theory corresponding to the Bose-Einstein distribution
entry.summary: The notion of density of a finite set is discussed. We proof a general theorem of set theory which refines Bose-Einstein distribution.

entry.title: From operads and PROPs to Feynman Processes
entry.summary: Operads and PROPs are presented, together with examples and applications to quantum physics suggesting the structure of Feynman categories/PROPs and the corresponding algebras.

entry.title: Quantum Layers over Surfaces Ruled Outside a Compact Set
entry.summary: In this paper, we proved the quantum layer over a surface which is ruled outside a compact set, asymptotically flat but not totally geodesic admits ground states.

entry.title: On a Calderon-Zygmund commutator-type estimate
entry.summary: In this paper we extend a Calderon-Zygmund commutator-type estimate. This estimate enables us to prove an embedding result concerning weighted function spaces.

entry.title: Asymptotically Hyperbolic Metrics on Unit Ball Admitting Multiple Horizons
entry.summary: In this paper, we construct an asymptotically hyperbolic metric with scalar curvature -6 on unit ball $\mathbf{D}^3$, which contains multiple horizons.

entry.title: A dilemma of nonequivalent definitions of differential operators in noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: In contrast with differential operators on modules over commutative and graded commutative rings, there is no satisfactory notion of a differential operator in noncommutative geometry.

entry.title: Smoothness of Algebraic Supervarieties and Supergroups
entry.summary: In this paper we discuss the notion of smoothness in complex algebraic supergeometry and we prove that all affine complex algebraic supergroups are smooth. We then prove the stabilizer theorem in the algebraic context, providing some useful applications.

entry.title: On some special directed last-passage percolation models
entry.summary: We investigate extended processes given by last-passage times in directed models defined using exponential variables with decaying mean. In certain cases we find the universal Airy process, but other cases lead to non-universal and trivial extended processes.

entry.title: Ground state solutions to the nonlinear Schrodinger-Maxwell equations
entry.summary: We prove the existence of ground state solutions for the nonlinear Schrodinger-Maxwell equations.

entry.title: Finding Exact Values For Infinite Sums
entry.summary: This paper offers a solution method that allows one to find exact values for a large class of convergent series of rational terms. Sums of this form arise often in problems dealing with Quantum Field Theory.

entry.title: Generating Functions for Multi-j-Symbols
entry.summary: A formula is derived that provides generating functions for any multi-j-symbol, such as the 3-j-symbol, the 6-j-symbol, the 9-j-symbol, etc. The result is completely determined by geometrical objects (loops and curves) in the graph of the the multi-j-symbol. A geometric-combinatorical interpretation for multi-j-symbols is given.

entry.title: Generalized Weierstrass representation for surfaces and Lax-Phillips scattering theory for automorphic functions
entry.summary: Relation between generalized Weierstrass representation for conformal immersion of generic surfaces into three-dimensional space and Lax-Phillips scattering theory for automorphic functions is considered.

entry.title: Identities involving elementary symmetric functions
entry.summary: A systematic procedure for generating certain identities involving elementary symmetric functions is proposed. These identities, as particular cases, lead to new identities for binomial and q-binomial coefficients.

entry.title: Physico--Mathematical Interactions: The Chern--Simons Story
entry.summary: The essential role played by Chern--Simons terms in a variety of physical models provides yet another illustration of the unexpected but profound interactions between the two disciplines.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages; contribution to proceedings dedicated to the 65th Anniversary of L.D. Faddeev

entry.title: Deduction of the law of motion of the charges from Maxwell equations
entry.summary: By exploiting suitably a fundamental theorem by Hilbert, we show that the equation of motion of the electric charges is a consequence of Maxwell field equations.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, PDF from MS-Word97, e-mail: sloinger@tin.it

entry.title: Uniform spectral properties of one-dimensional quasicrystals, I. Absence of eigenvalues
entry.summary: We consider discrete one-dimensional Schr\"odinger operators with Sturmian potentials. For a full-measure set of rotation numbers including the Fibonacci case we prove absence of eigenvalues for all elements in the hull.

entry.title: On the geometric arena of supermechanics
entry.summary: In the case of simple graded manifolds utilized in supermechanics, supervector fields and exterior superforms are represented by global sections of smooth vector bundles.

entry.title: Constrained Fock spaces as Virasoro modules
entry.summary: The method of constrained Hamiltonian systems can be used to reduce Fock modules. It is applied to the Virasoro algebra, where a possibly new realization is found.

entry.title: The Atiyah-Singer fixed point theorem and the gauge field copy problem
entry.summary: A condition for the existence of false gauge field copies in terms of the Lefschetz number of a certain differential operator is presented.

entry.title: Comment on ``A simple expression for the terms in the Baker-Campbell-Hausdorff series''
entry.summary: It is pointed out that Reinsch's matrix operation formulation of calculating the Baker-Campbell-Hausdorff series [math-ph/9905012] is equivalent to the straightforward series expansion. The amount of calculation does not decrease by his method.

entry.title: New bounds on the Lieb-Thirring constants
entry.summary: Improved estimates on the constants $L_{\gamma,d}$, for $1/2<\gamma<3/2$, $d\in N$ in the inequalities for the eigenvalue moments of Schr\"{o}dinger operators are established.

entry.title: On the Connes-Kreimer construction of Hopf Algebras
entry.summary: We give a universal construction of families of Hopf $P$-algebras for any Hopf operad $P$. As a special case, we recover the Connes-Kreimer Hopf algebra of rooted trees.

entry.title: Eigenfunctions, transfer matrices, and absolutely continuous spectrum of one-dimensional Schrodinger operators
entry.summary: Neat stuff about eigenfunctions, transfer matrices, and a.c. spectrum of one-dimensional Schrodinger operators

entry.title: Integrable systems in spaces of arbitrary dimension
entry.summary: The $2n$ dimensional manifold with two mutually commutative operators of differentiation is introduced. Nontrivial multidimensional integrable systems connected with arbitrary graded (semisimple) algebras are constructed. The general solution of them is presented in explicit form.

entry.title: Point interactions in a tube
entry.summary: We discuss discuss spectral and scattering properties of a particle confined to a straight Dirichlet tube in $\mathbb{R}^3$ with a family of point interactions.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMSTeX, 10 pages, written for the jubilee volume dedicated to the 60th birthday of Sergio Albeverio

entry.title: Distributional Borel Summability of Odd Anharmonic Oscillators
entry.summary: It is proved that the divergent Rayleigh-Schrodinger perturbation expansions for the eigenvalues of any odd anharmonic oscillator are Borel summable in the distributional sense to the resonances naturally associated with the system.

entry.title: BRS Cohomology And The Chern Character In Non-Commutative Geometry
entry.summary: We establish a general local formula computing the topological anomaly of gauge theories in the framework of non-commutative geometry.

entry.title: Hamilton-Jakobi method for classical mechanics in Grassmann algebra
entry.summary: We present the Hamilton-Jakobi method for the classical mechanics with constrains in Grassmann algebra. In the frame of this method the solution for the classical system characterized by the SUSY Lagrangian is obtained.

entry.title: The Reeh-Schlieder Property for the Dirac Field on Static Spacetimes
entry.summary: We prove the Reeh-Schlieder property for the ground- and KMS-states states of the massive Dirac Quantum field on a static globally hyperbolic 4 dimensional spacetime.

entry.title: Tables of Integrals of Complex-valued Functions of p-Adic arguments
entry.summary: Part I. Some Facts From p-Adic Analysis. Part II. Tables of Integrals.

entry.title: Justification of the limiting absorption principle in R2
entry.summary: The limiting absorption principle in two-dimensional space is justified for a second-order elliptic operators. Necessary and sufficient conditions for the right-hand side are given for this principle to be valid.

entry.title: The Energy-Momentum Tensor for Gravitational Interactions
entry.summary: Within the Lagrange formalism we show that the gauge invariant total energy-momentum tensor for gravitational interactions is zero. If the equations of motion are satisfied the energy tensor is conserved.

entry.title: PT symmetric form of the Hulthen potential
entry.summary: The fourth, missing example of an exactly solvable complex potential with PT symmetry V(x) = [V(-x)]^* defined on a bent contour and leading, at the real energies, to the Jacobi polynomial wave functions is found in a generalized Hulthen interaction.

entry.title: Beyond Octonions
entry.summary: We investigate Clifford Algebras structure over non-ring division algebras. We show how projection over the real field produces the standard Attiyah-Bott-Shapiro classification.

entry.title: Dominos and the Gaussian free field
entry.summary: We define a scaling limit of the height function on the domino tiling model (dimer model) on simply-connected regions in Z^2 and show that it is the ``massless free field'', a Gaussian process with independent coefficients when expanded in the eigenbasis of the Laplacian.

entry.title: Absolute Continuity of the Floquet Spectrum for a Nonlinearly Forced Harmonic Oscillator
entry.summary: We prove that the Floquet spectrum of a class of time-periodic Schroedinger equations under a a mildly nonlinear resonant forcing is purely absolutely continuous.

entry.title: Asymptotic behaviour of a solution for Kadomtsev-Petviashvili-2 equation
entry.summary: An asymptotic behaviour of solution of Kadomtsev-Petviashvili-2 equation is obtained as $t\to\infty$ uniformly with respect to spatial variables.

entry.title: An Introduction to Quantum Algebras and Their Applications
entry.summary: A very elementary introduction to quantum algebras is presented and a few examples of their physical applications are mentioned.

author.name: R. Jaganathan
author.arxiv:affiliation: The Institute of Mathematical Sciences, India

entry.title: Combinatorial Identities from the Spectral Theory of Quantum Graphs
entry.summary: We present a few combinatorial identities which were encountered in our work on the spectral theory of quantum graphs. They establish a new connection between the theory of random matrix ensembles and combinatorics.

entry.title: Lieb-Thirring Inequalities
entry.summary: This is a brief review of Lieb-Thirring inequalities for eigenvalues of the Schroedinger operator and lower bounds for the quantum mechanical kinetic energy (and some generalizations) in R^n.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Kluwer Encyclopedia of Mathematics, Supplement vol.II, p. 311-313 (2000)

entry.title: Thomas-Fermi Theory
entry.summary: This is a brief review of the Thomas-Fermi ("statistical" or "density functional") theory of atoms and molecules.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Kluwer Encyclopedia of Mathematics, Supplement vol.II, p.455-457 (2000)

entry.title: On the obstruction to the exactness of the variational bicomplex
entry.summary: We study the obstruction to the exactness of the variational complex for a field theory on an affine bundle.

entry.title: Cohomology of the infinite-order jet space
entry.summary: De Rham cohomology, $d_V$- and $d_H$-cohomology of the differential algebra of locally pull-back exterior forms on the infinite-order jet manifold of a smooth fibre bundle are calculated.

entry.title: On p-adic path integral
entry.summary: Feynman's path integral is generalized to quantum mechanics on p-adic space and time. Such p-adic path integral is analytically evaluated for quadratic Lagrangians. Obtained result has the same form as that one in ordinary quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Some Remarks Concerning the Feynman "Integral over All Paths" Method
entry.summary: Suppose we have two nonequivalent but s-equivalent Lagrange functions, the question arises: are they both equally well fitted for the Feynman quantization procedure or do they lead to two different quantization schemes.

entry.title: Feynman Equation in Hamiltonian Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: Functional Schr\"{o}dinger equations for interacting fields are solved via rigorous non-perturbative Feynman type integrals.

entry.title: Entropy production in quantum spin systems
entry.summary: We consider a quantum spin system consisting of a finite subsystem connected to infinite reservoirs at different temperatures. In this setup we define nonequilibrium steady states and prove that the rate of entropy production in such states is nonnegative.

entry.title: Some Comments on the RHS Formulation of Resonance Scattering
entry.summary: We discuss the validity of a formula concerning a relation between functionals in quantum resonance scattering, which is often used in the current literature.

entry.title: Mapping Integer Order Neumann Functions To Real Orders
entry.summary: In a recent paper we unified Bessel functions of different orders .Here we extend the unification to other linairely independant solutions to Bessel equation, Neumann's and Hankel's functions

entry.title: Nonlinear boundary value problem of magnetic insulation
entry.summary: On the basis of generalization of upper and lower solution method to the singular two point boundary value problems, the existence theorem of solutions for the system, which models a process of magnetic insulation in plasma is proved.

entry.title: On bifurcation points of the stationary Vlasov-Maxwell system with bifurcation direction
entry.summary: The theorem on the existence of bifurcation points of the stationary solutions for the Vlasov-Maxwell system with bifurcation direction is proved.

entry.title: Path integral formulation of constrained systems with singular-higher order Lagrangian
entry.summary: Systems with singular higher order- Lagrangians are investigated by using the extended form of the canonical method. Besides, the canonical path integral formulation is generalized using the Hamilton- jacobi formulation to investigate singular systems

entry.title: Canonical formulation treatment of a free relativistic spinning particle
entry.summary: The canonical method of constrained system is discussed. The equations of motion for a free relativistic spinning particle are obtained without using gauge fixing conditions. The quantization of this model is discussed.

entry.title: Quantization of singular systems with second order Lagrangians
entry.summary: The path integral formulation of singular systems with second order Lagrangian is studied by using the canonical path integral method. The path integral of Podolsky electrodynamics is studied.

entry.title: Riemannian Geometries
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. It will be replaced, substantially modified, by sections of the author's completed PhD thesis.

entry.title: Finite action solutions of SO(2,1) Hitchin's equations
entry.summary: We present a 1-parameter family of finite action solutions to the $S0(2,1)$ Hitchin's equations and explore some of its basic properties. For a fixed value of the parameter, the solution is smooth. We conclude by showing a multi-particle generalization of our basic solutions.

entry.title: The $M_{L}(z);C_{L}(z);W_{L}(z)$ associated Laguerre Polynomials
entry.summary: In a previous paper we deformed Hermite polynomials to three associated polynomials .Here we apply the same deformation to Laguerre polynomials .

entry.title: The Volterra lattice as a gradient flow
entry.summary: The Volterra lattice is considered. New gradient interpretation for this dynamical system is proposed. This interpretation seems to be more natural than existing ones.

entry.title: Propagation and interaction of shock waves of quasilinear equation
entry.summary: We propose a new regularization method for constructing a shock wave type solution with nonsmooth front (interaction of shock waves) for quasilinear equations in the one-dimensional case.

entry.title: A unified representation of the q-oscillator and the q-plane
entry.summary: Using deformations inspired by relativistic considerations and phase space symmetry, we deform the position and momentum operators in one dimension. The resulting algebra is shown to yield the q-oscillator algebra in one limiting case and the q-plane commutation relation in another.

entry.title: Self-dual Chern-Simons Vortices on Riemann Surfaces
entry.summary: We study self-dual multi-vortex solutions of Chern-Simons Higgs theory in a background curved spacetime. The existence and decaying property of a solution are demonstrated.

entry.title: More noncommutative 4-spheres
entry.summary: New examples of noncommutative 4-spheres are introduced.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, AMS-LaTeX, final version, revised, to appear in Lett.Math.Phys

entry.title: Multi-dimensional Diffeomorphism and Current Algebras from Virasoro and Kac-Moody Currents
entry.summary: The recently constructed Fock representations of $N$-dimensional diffeomorphism and current algebras are reformulated in terms of one-dimensional currents, satisfying Virasoro and affine Kac-Moody algebras.

entry.title: Remark on the Serre-Swan theorem for non-compact manifolds
entry.summary: The Serre-Swan theorem provides the link between projective modules of finite rank and vector bundles over compact manifolds, and plays a prominent role in non-commutative geometry. Its extension to non-compact manifolds is discussed.

entry.title: Factorization of Unitary Matrices
entry.summary: Factorization of an $n\times n$ unitary matrix as a product of $n$ diagonal matrices containing only phases interlaced with $n-1$ orthogonal matrices each one generated by a real vector as well as an explicit form for the Weyl factorization are found.

entry.title: Meromorphic Solutions to a Differential--Difference Equation Describing Certain Self-Similar Potentials
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the existence of meromorphic solutions to a nonlinear differential difference equation that describe certain self-similar potentials for the Schroedinger operator.

entry.title: Numerical computation of resonance poles in scattering theory
entry.summary: We present a possible way of computing resonance poles and modes in scattering theory. Numerical examples are given for the scattering of electromagnetic waves by finite-size photonic crystals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 figures, submitted to Phys. Rev. E

entry.title: Impenetrable Barriers and Canonical Quantization
entry.summary: We address a conceptual issue of reconciling the traditional canonical quantization framework of quantum theory with the spatially restricted quantum dynamics and the related spectral problems for confined and global observables of the quantum system.

entry.title: Stocastic variational principle on riemannian manifolds
entry.summary: Some little considerations concerning the application of the Theory of Dirichlet Forms to stocastic variational principle on riemannian manifolds are performed

entry.title: Series Representation of the Modified Bessel Functions
entry.summary: Some power series representations of the modified Bessel functions (McDonald functions $K_{\alpha}$) are derived using the relatively little known formalism of fractional derivatives. The resulting summation formulae are believed to be new.

entry.title: Numerically efficient version of the T-matrix method
entry.summary: A version of the projection method for solving the scattering problem for acoustic and electromagnetic waves is proposed and shown to be more efficient numerically than the earlier ones because the corresponding matrix is not ill-conditioned.

entry.title: Classification of solutions of a Toda system in R^2
entry.summary: We consider solutions of a Toda system for SU(N+1) and show that any solution with finite exponential integral cam be obtained from a rational curve in complex projective space of dimension N

entry.title: Free particle on SU(2) group manifold
entry.summary: In the present paper detailed coordinate free description of the classical and quantum dynamics of free particle on SU(2) group manifold is carried out.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX 2e, 9 pages, no figures, uses iopart.cls

entry.title: The q-deformation of AKNS-D Hierarchy
entry.summary: In this paper, we considered the q-deformation of AKNS-D hierarchy, proved the bilinear identity and give out the $\tau$-function of the q-deformed AKNS-D hierarchy.

entry.title: Approach to Equilibrium for a Forced Burgers Equation
entry.summary: We show that approach to equilibrium in certain forced Burgers equations is implied by a decay estimate on a suitable intrinsic semigroup estimate, and we verify this estimate in a variety of cases including a periodic force.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Journal of Evolution Equations

entry.title: Singularity Formation in 2+1 Wave Maps
entry.summary: We present numerical evidence that singularities form in finite time during the evolution of 2+1 wave maps from spherically equivariant initial data of sufficient energy.

entry.title: How should one define entropy production for nonequilibrium quantum spin systems?
entry.summary: This paper discusses entropy production in nonequilibrium steady states for infinite quantum spin systems. Rigorous results have been obtained recently in this area, but a physical discussion shows that some questions of principle remain to be clarified.

entry.title: Combinatorial identities for binary necklaces from exact ray-splitting trace formulae
entry.summary: Based on an exact trace formula for a one-dimensional ray-splitting system, we derive novel combinatorial identities for cyclic binary sequences (P\'olya necklaces).

entry.title: Fractality of certain quantum states
entry.summary: We prove the theorem announced in Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 85}:5022, 2001 concerning the existence and properties of fractal states for the Schr\"odinger equation in the infinite one-dimensional well.

entry.title: A counterexample to the uniqueness result of Cox and Thompson
entry.summary: A counterexample is given to the uniqueness result given in the paper by J.Cox and K.Thompson, "Note on the uniqueness of the solution of an equation of interest in inverse scattering problem", J. Math.Phys., 11, N3, (1970), 815-817.

entry.title: Separation of variables for quantum integrable models related to $ U_q(\hat{sl}_N) $
entry.summary: In this paper we construct separated variables for quantum integrable models related to the algebra $U_q(\hat{sl}_N)$. This generalizes the results by Sklyanin for $N=2,3$.

entry.title: Applications of the Wulff construction to the number theory
entry.summary: We apply the geometric construction of solutions of some variational problems of combinatorics to estimate the number of partitions and of plane partitions of an integer.

entry.title: Practical non-Abelian Stokes theorem for topologically nontrivial Wilson loops
entry.summary: A practical implementation of the non-Abelian Stokes theorem for topologically nontrivial loops (knots) with possible intersections is proposed.

entry.title: Fluctuations of the Entropy Production in Anharmonic Chains
entry.summary: We prove the Gallavotti-Cohen fluctuation theorem for a model of heat conduction through a chain of anharmonic oscillators coupled to two Hamiltonian reservoirs at different temperatures.

entry.title: Butterflies and topological quantum numbers
entry.summary: The Hofstadter model illustrates the notion of topological quantum numbers and how they account for the quantization of the Hall conductance. It gives rise to colorful fractal diagrams of butterflies where the colors represent the topological quantum numbers.

entry.title: Asymptotic properties of the differential equation $h^3(h''+h')=1$
entry.summary: We derive the form of the asymptotic series, as $t\to +\infty$, for a general solution $h(t)$ of the non-linear differential equation $h(t)^{3}(h''(t)+h'(t))=1$.

entry.title: On the Spectrum of Holonomy Algebras
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Regularization of Ill-Posed Problems with Unbounded Operators
entry.summary: Variational regularization and the quasisolutions method are justified for unbounded closed, possibly nonlinear, operators. The argument is quite simple and yields general results.

entry.title: Completely integrable classical systems connected with semi-simple Lie algebras. II
entry.summary: The complete integrability of a class of dynamical systems with the potential v(q)=q^{-2}+c q^2 is proved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, an old paper (1976) posted for archival purposes

entry.title: The Thom Class and Localization of SUSY QM Generating Functional
entry.summary: We demonstrate the usage of explicit form of the Thom class found by Mathai and Quillen for the definition of generating functional of a simple supersymmetric quantum mechanical model.

entry.title: Lax representation for the systems of S.Kowalevskaya type
entry.summary: We descibe a number of dynamical systems that are generalizations of S. Kowalevskaya system and admit the Lax representation.

entry.title: Complexes of modules over exceptional Lie superalgebras $E (3,8)$ and $E (5,10)$
entry.summary: In this paper complexes of generalized Verma modules over the infinite-dimensional exceptional Lie superalgebras $E (3,8)$ and $E(5,10)$ are constructed and studied.

entry.title: The covariant Lyapunov tensor and the Lyapunov stability with respect to time-dependent Riemannian metrics
entry.summary: We show that any solution of a smooth first order dynamic equation can be made Lyapunov stable at will by the choice of an appropriate time-dependent Riemannian metric.

entry.title: On the derivatives of generalized Gegenbauer polynomials
entry.summary: We prove some new formulae for the derivatives of the generalized Gegenbauer polynomials associated to the Lie algebra $A_2$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, no figures; submitted to Theor. Math. Phys

entry.title: Some Theorems in Thermoelasticity for Micropolar Porous Media
entry.summary: Within the context of a linear theory of heat-flux dependent thermoelasticity for micropolar porous media some variational principles and a reciprocal relation are derived.

entry.title: On entanglement of states and quantum correlations
entry.summary: In this paper we present the novel qualities of entanglement of formation for general (so also infinite dimensional) quantum systems and we introduce the notion of coefficient of quantum correlations. Our presentation stems from rigorous description of entanglement of formation.

entry.title: On Kolgomorov-Sinai entropy and its quantization
entry.summary: In the paper we present the new approach to Kolmogorov-Sinai entropy and its quantization. Our presentation stems from an application of the Choquet theory to the theory of decompositions of states and therefore, it resembles our rigorous description of entanglement of formation

entry.title: WITHDRAWN: Adiabatic charge transport and the Kubo formula for 2D Hall conductance
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to an error in the proof of Lemma 3.1.

entry.title: On the classification of subalgebras of Cend_N and gc_N
entry.summary: The problem of classification of infinite subalgebras of Cend_N and of gc_N that acts irreducibly on $\Bbb C[\partial]^N$ is discussed in this paper.

entry.title: On a Factorization of Symmetric Matrices and Antilinear Symmetries
entry.summary: We present a simple proof of the factorization of (complex) symmetric matrices into a product of a square matrix and its transpose, and discuss its application in establishing a uniqueness property of certain antilinear operators.

entry.title: Discrete spectral triples converging to dirac operators
entry.summary: We exhibit some series of discrete spectral triples converging to the canonical spectral triple of a finite dimensional manifold. Thus the non-go theorem of Goekeler and Schuecker is reasonably bypassed.

entry.title: On eigenvalues of discrete Schrödinger operators with potentials of Coulomb type decay
entry.summary: We study the distribution of the eigenvalues inside of the essential spectrum for discrete one-dimensional Schr\"odinger operators with potentials of Coulomb type decay.

entry.title: Jacobi fields of completely integrable Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We show that Jacobi fields of a completely integrable Hamiltonian system of m degrees of freedom also make up a completely integrable system. They provide m additional first integrals which characterize a relative motion.

entry.title: p-Adic representation of the Cuntz algebra and the free coherent states
entry.summary: Representation of the Cuntz algebra in the space of (complex valued) functions on p-adic disk is introduced. The relation of this representation and the free coherent states is investigated.

entry.title: Mean-Field Approximation of Quantum Systems and Classical Limit
entry.summary: We prove that, for a smooth two-body potentials, the quantum mean-field approximation to the nonlinear Schroedinger equation of the Hartree type is stable at the classical limit h \to 0, yielding the classical Vlasov equation.

entry.title: Discrete Polynomials and Discrete Holomorphic Approximation
entry.summary: We use discrete holomorphic polynomials to prove that, given a refining sequence of critical maps of a Riemann surface, any holomorphic function can be approximated by a converging sequence of discrete holomorphic functions.

entry.title: Exactly solvable periodic Darboux q-chains
entry.summary: A difference q-analogue of the dressing chain is discussed in this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, to appear in Russian Math. Surveys

entry.title: On Local Perturbations of SCHRÖdinger Operator on Plane
entry.summary: We obtain necessary and sufficient conditions for emerging of small eigenvalue for Schr\"odinger operator on plane under local operator perturbations. In the case the eigenvalue emerges we construct its asymptotics. The examples are given.

entry.title: On quantizing semisimple basic algebras II: The general case
entry.summary: We prove that there is no consistent polynomial quantization of the coordinate ring of a basic non-nilpotent coadjoint orbit of a semisimple Lie group.

entry.title: A few comments on N=2 supersymmetric Landau-Ginzburg theories
entry.summary: In present note I give two new examples of Landau-Ginzburg theories considered in detail in recent paper by Cecotti and Vafa

entry.title: Exponentials form a basis of discrete holomorphic functions
entry.summary: We show that discrete exponentials form a basis of discrete holomorphic functions. On a convex, the discrete polynomials form a basis as well.

entry.title: Distributional Borel Summability for Vacuum Polarization by an External Electric Field
entry.summary: It is proved that the divergent perturbation expansion for the vacuum polarization by an external constant electric field in the pair production sector is Borel summable in the distributional sense.

entry.title: A weaker geodesic completeness and Clifton-Pohl torus
entry.summary: We propose a new definition of geodesic completeness, based on analytical continuation in the complex domain: we apply this idea to Clifton-Pohl torus, relating, for each geodesic, completeness to the value of a function of initial conditions, called 'impulse'.

entry.title: Real Commuting Differential Operators Connected with Two-Dimensional Abelian Varieties
entry.summary: We indicate smooth real commuting matrix differential operators whose eigenvalues and eigenfunctions are parametrized by two-dimensional principally polarized abelian varieties.

entry.title: Commutative Rings of Differential Operators Corresponding to Multidimensional Algebraic Varieties
entry.summary: We construct new examples of multidimensional commuting matrix differential operators and a multidimensional analog of the Kadomtsev--Petviashvili hierarchy.

entry.title: Dirac-type tensor equations on a parallelisable manyfolds
entry.summary: The goal of this work is to extend Dirac-type tensor equations to a curved space. We take four 1-forms (a tetrad) as a unique structure, which determines a geometry of space-time.

entry.title: The Dirac equation vs. the Dirac type tensor equation
entry.summary: We discuss a connection between the Dirac equation for an electron and the Dirac type tensor equation with ${\rm U}(1)$ gauge symmetry.

entry.title: P.S. to the paper "Dirac type tensor equations with nonabelian gauge symmetries on pseudo-Riemannian space"
entry.summary: We improve the concept of our previous paper "Dirac type tensor equations with nonabelian gauge symmetries on pseudo-Riemannian space" and present a new compact formula for the tensor $B_\mu$.

entry.title: Analyticity of the density of electronic wavefunctions
entry.summary: We prove that the electronic densities of atomic and molecular eigenfunctions are real analytic in ${\mathbb R}^3$ away from the nuclei.

entry.title: A concept of Dirac-type tensor equations
entry.summary: Considering a four dimensional parallelisable manifold, we develop a concept of Dirac-type tensor equations with wave functions that belong to left ideals of the set of nonhomogeneous complex valued differential forms.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment 'On large-N expansion'
entry.summary: Fernandez Comment [1] on our pseudo-perturbative shifted-l expansion technique [2,3] is either unfounded or ambiguous.

entry.title: The Cauchy problem for the semilinear quintic Schrödinger equation in one dimension,the defocusing case
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: The Singularity of Kontsevich's Solution for $QH^{*}(CP^2)$
entry.summary: We study the singularity of the Kontsevich's solution of the WDVV equations of associativity. We prove that it corresponds to a singularity in the change of two coordinates systems of the Frobenius manifold given by the quantum cohomology of $CP^2$.

entry.title: Erratum: Pseudo-Hermiticity for a class of nondiagonalizable Hamiltonians [J. Math. Phys. 43, 6343 (2002); math-ph/0207009]
entry.summary: An error in the paper [J. Math. Phys. 43, 6343 (2002); math-ph/0207009] is corrected. Further explanation is given.

entry.title: Dynamical systems where time is a quantum group and quantum ergodicity
entry.summary: We define dynamical systems where time is a quantum group. We give the definition of quantum ergodicity for the introduced dynamical system with noncommutative (or quantum) time, and discuss the examples.

entry.title: Monotonicity and Thermodynamic Limit for Short Range Disordered Models
entry.summary: If the variance of a short range Gaussian random potential grows like the volume its quenched thermodynamic limit is reached monotonically.

entry.title: Topological quantum numbers in the Hall effect
entry.summary: Topological quantum numbers account for the precise quantization that occurs in the integer Hall effect. In this theory, Kubo's formula for the conductance acquires a topological interpretation in terms of Chern numbers and their non-commutative analog, the Fredholm Indices.

entry.title: On the notion of a differential operator in noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: The algebraic notion of a differential operator on a module over a commutative ring is not extended to a module over a noncommutative ring.

entry.title: Affine Weyl group approach to Painlevé equations
entry.summary: An overview is given on recent developments in the affine Weyl group approach to Painlev\'e equations and discrete Painlev\'e equations, based on the joint work with Y. Yamada and K. Kajiwara.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 497--510

entry.title: Geometric tools of the adiabatic complex WKB method
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to the description of the main geometric and analytic tools of a complex WKB method for adiabatic problem. We illustrate their use by numerous examples.

entry.title: Gravitational potential energy group theoretically
entry.summary: We show by symplectically realizing the one spatial Aristotle Lie group that the hamiltonian of the associated elementary system consist of a gravitational energy only. No kinetic term.

entry.title: Erratum: Instantaneous frequency and amplitude identification using wavelets: Application to glass structure
entry.summary: Typographical corrections to the original paper, intended for publication in Physical Review E.

entry.title: Jackson's q-exponential as the exponential of a series
entry.summary: Jackson's q-exponential is expressed as the exponential of a series whose coefficients are obtained in closed form. Such a relation is used to derive some properties of the q-exponential.

entry.title: Magnetostriction Transition
entry.summary: We present a non mean-field model which undergoes a magnetostriction phase transition in the temperature. That is, the crystal becomes sharply contracted and magnetized once the temperature passes below the critical value

entry.title: Dynamics of granular gases
entry.summary: A complete theory for the dynamics of granular gases is presented. A balance equation involving a stirring tensor and ruling the evolution of Reynold's tensor accrues in addition to the continuity equation and the standard Cauchy's balance. Special flows are discussed explicitly.

entry.title: Tunneling effects between tori in double wells
entry.summary: We consider tunneling between 2 symmetric potential wells for a 2-d Schrodinger operator, in the case of eigenvalues associated with quasi-modes supported on KAM or Birkhoff tori.
entry.arxiv:comment: to be presented as a poster in the session Quantum Mechanics and Spectral Theory, IAMP, 2003

entry.title: Construction of Lie Superalgebras from Triple Product Systems
entry.summary: Any simple Lie superalgebras over the complex field can be constructed from some triple systems. Examples of Lie superalgebras $D(2,1;\alpha)$, G(3) and F(4) are given by utilizing a general construction method based upon $(-1,-1)$ balanced Freudenthal-Kantor triple system.
